group.name: paypal_pro
group.string: Show PayPal acceptance mark in page footer?

A URL to your logo image. Use a valid graphics format, such as .gif, .jpg, or .png. Limit the image to 190 pixels wide by 60 pixels high. PayPal crops images that are larger. PayPal places your logo image at the top of the cart review area. PayPal recommends that you store the image on a secure (https) server. Otherwise, web browsers display a message that checkout pages contain non-secure items. If this field is left empty and the store has SSL enabled CubeCart will automatically send PayPal your store logo.
The HTML hex code for your principal identifying color. PayPal blends your color to white in a gradient fill that borders the cart review area of the PayPal checkout user interface.
Your payment has been accepted but requires manual review by a member of staff. Please accept our apologies for any delay in the process of your order.

Your payment has been declined. Please check that your billing address matches that of your card and that the three digit security code is correct. If the issue persists please contact a member of staff.
Your payment has been declined. This is probably because your card has expired so please check this and if this isnt the case and the issue persists, please contact a member of staff.
Your payment has been declined. This is due to your bank declining the payment so please check this with your issuing bank. If the issue persists please contact a member of staff.
Call back from PayPal Checkout can only be enabled if the store is running with SSL enabled. It is highly recommended to obtain an SSL certificate and enable this feature.
No, I will be capture more funds against this later.
Yes, no further captures will be made after this one.
Website Payments Pro Hosted & Express Checkout
* If you manage your PayPal account at manager.paypal.com or know that your account uses Payflow then the vendor and partner fields are required for 3D secure. If not please leave these fields empty.

The Instant Payment Notification (IPN) URL can be set in the Profile section of your PayPal account. This allows PayPal to send callback requests to your store to automatically deal with refunds, chargebacks etc…
Enable BillMeLater [Learn More]
